subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Keyboard mappings and keyboard layouts
msgSnippet: ... The snag with color coding is that it goes away in a black-and- white printout, unless the colors are chosen to give different shades of gray. {D sNag wi
messageBody:
On 8.1.2008 Moira O'Brien wrote:
> Can I suggest though that you use colour to identify the
> disputed letters - eg red for disagreements and pale
> orange for substantial agreement. This will make it much
> easier to read.
>

The snag with color coding is that it goes away in a
black-and- white printout, unless the colors are chosen to
give different shades of gray.

{D sNag wi kolur kOdG z Dt i gOz uwE iN u blak n WYt
priNtUt, cNles D kolurZ r COzN t giv difreNt SERZ/SEdz v
grE.}


/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
No man forgets his original trade: the rights of
nations and of kings sink into questions of grammar,
if grammarians discuss them.
-Dr. Samuel Johnson (1707 - 1784)
